availability.p: All research and writing of Civil War Governors of Kentucky Digital Documentary Edition annotations was undertaken by project staff, volunteers, and interns. Each record contains citations to relevant primary and secondary source material. All annotations are copyright Kentucky Historical Society, and should be referenced as such in any published work.

seriesStmt.title: Civil War Governors of Kentucky Digital Documentary Edition

body.p:
Kentucky farmer. Lived in Hopkins County in 1860. Married on three occasions, first to Zerelda Graham Clift, on a second occasion to Susan Minerva Lansden Clift, and on a third occasion to Nancy A. Craig Clift. Father of Jemison R. Clift, Hannah S. Clift, Susan S. Clift,
Sarah F. Clift, Alzada E. Clift, and Robert R. Clift. Member of the Masonic Order at Madisonville Lodge, No. 143.

bibl.p: Eighth Manuscript Census of the United States (1860), Population Schedules, Kentucky, Hopkins County, p. 86; Proceedings of the Grand Lodge of kentucky, at the Grand Annual Communication, in the City of Louisville (Frankfort, Ky.: Frankfort Commonwealth, 1867), 128; "Majority and Minority Reports in the Contested Election Case of Morton against Gregory, made to the House or Representatives, December 18, 1865," in Legislative Document, No. 13, (Frankfort, Ky.: George D. Prentice, State Printer, 1865), 36-37; "Moses Clift," (https://www.findagrave.com/cgi-bin/fg.cgi?page=gr&GRid=64263061&ref=acom) (accessed on March 23, 2017).
